content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-198-02-A |Item_parent=Microcrystalline arthropathies |Item_parent_short=Microcrystalline arthropathies |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the threshold value for hyperuricemia |Description=360 µmol/l or 60 mg/l |Rubric=Definition |Contributors= |Order=2}} The solubility threshold for urates is 360 µmol/l or 60 mg/l.

question.title: What is the solubility threshold for urates in blood?
question.description: A measure of uric acid concentration

option_a.title: 300 µmol/l
option_a.description: A common misconception about the threshold value

option_b.title: 360 µmol/l or 60 mg/l
option_b.description: The correct threshold value for hyperuricemia

option_c.title: 400 µmol/l
option_c.description: A value above the threshold, but not the correct answer

option_d.title: None of the above
option_d.description: An incorrect generalization about the threshold value

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: A single letter indicating the correct option
